I have found the 14k gold from India to be much softer than that of the jewelry made in the USA. I re-read the description of the ring and I could not see anywhere that the ring was made in India, so I take a full star off for that.The other disappointment I had is that the ring only comes in whole sizes. Unfortunately, I needed the half size in order for it to fit on the intended finger. So, with that, I have to wear it on the opposite hand that I wanted and on a different finger than I wanted it for. I'd take a half star off for the sizing issue.The ring is not so noticeable from a distance, but when the sun or a light catches it, it does sparkle. It is beautifully set as a low profile ring and there are NO prongs sticking out to catch on towels or delicate clothing, one thing that I appreciate most in an everyday wearable ring.All in all, it is a beautiful ring, but for the reasons mentioned above, I'd rate it 3.5 stars and would definitely recommend it to others if they're looking for this style and type of ring. If it holds up and doesn't lose any of the diamond chips over time, then I'd consider this a great investment. I did not purchase the $45 insurance because that would've pushed the cost of the ring over what I wanted to spend and I can get insurance on it through my personal homeowner's insurance for far cheaper.As a side note, the ring did not come with any paperwork of authenticity as it shows in some of the other Ross Simons rings descriptions, so that was a bit of a disappointment too.

reviewDescription: To say one ring for sale is better than another really isn't possible, there are lots of pretty costume jewelry rings out there that are stunning and well priced, and I own a few. I can't say this or that is better, I like how different rings have different qualities, so the very clear and light color of this stone is very much appreciated, I think it makes it look more like a diamond compared to some of my other rings that have the same description of stone but their stones aren't as pale as this one. I have not given this ring my own layers of protection yet, but I know the gemstones should not be clearcoated, just the metal, so cover the gemstones carefully to keep any clear coat you might add off of them or your ring will probably be ruined by a clear coat material that gets on the stones. The part that touches your skin is the main focus for clear coat after market protection, and that I'll test on a ring that is less beautiful than this one before I try to give my own layer of protection to this one. If you clear coat the inner band against the skin, make sure you're not allergic to the clear coat and that it's appropriate for your ring - do your research and testing carefully, as well as your coating. Remember, clear coatings can be removed by cleaners and chemicals like if you do dishes or cleaning, swimming pool chemicals, or showering, etc (hot tubs...) so take your beautiful jewelry off before any activities that might damage it, or as soon as you realize, and carefully clean.I highly recommend this ring. reviewDescription: This ring is beautiful! Shines great! It is large, very clear stine, looks like a diamond in color meaning it does not look like a piece of glass. It has facets in it and sparkles beautifully in sun and ambient lightening. It does not turn my finger green at all. I wore it for a week everyday, doing my normal days activities and it didn't effect it one bit. The sterling seems to be very plated on most likely has a rhodium flash on it. Anything plated without rhodium on me, turns my skin green. I have very high acid in my skin. This ring is great in every way, except the band is thin for a stone that size! I've bought a stainless steel wide band to pair with it! I know it's really going to make that ring pop! I bought an etched band and a wide plain band. Suppose to be here today. I will post a picture at that time with the band. It is true to size, does not spin on my finger. I. Clean it daily in the morning with a little dish soap and a soft tooth brush, rinse in warm water then cold and I dry and polish with an old cotton tee. It looks brand new Everytime. Do not use jewelry cleaner on any of this type jewelry!! It will RUIN your ring!! And it just never requires that type of cleaning. It will take the finish off your prongs even if the rest stays nice! Once my prongs turn brass, I pitch it! So many times even if the plating is solid and possibly rhodium flashed, often times the prongs are not! And a harsh chemical such as cleaners will take the plating right off those prongs! Just stick with soapy water and dry cotton cloth, it will be beautiful a very long time. I also have noticed with this type of cz it actually gains greater luster and shine over time for some reason. I've never had one to cloud on me with proper care. These type of cz have a certain look to them that you can spot in an actual photo of the ring after you've bought a few. It looks hard, it's clear, it's faceted, it reflects light similar to a diamond. However the 4 carat size makes other family and friends know it's fake. But if your a high society gal, that wants something to wear on vacation or when going out, and you generally wear big stones...Don't hesitate buy it, pair it with a beautiful band, a silver bracelet and off you go. Looks like a million bucks! Enjoy!
